name: Pope Gelasius I
summary: Gelasius I was Pope from 492 to 496. He is best known for his letter to Emperor Anastasius I in which he articulated the doctrine of the 'two swords' - spiritual and temporal power - asserting the superiority of spiritual authority. He was a prolific writer and worked to strengthen papal authority. He also compiled important liturgical texts and is credited with establishing the Gelasian Sacramentary.
keyQuotes: There are two powers by which this world is chiefly ruled: the sacred authority of the priesthood and the royal power.
